messages.content: Yo Tim, you got a sec? Been struggling with landing these interviews, man.
Brooo, say less, I got you. What’s the vibe rn? What’s stopping you from securing those LinkedIn bangers?
Honestly, idk. I’m applying to a ton of jobs, tweaking my resume, but it feels like it’s all going into the void.
Okok fr tho, are you hitting up recruiters? Slide into DMs like it’s Tinder but for jobs 💀. Shoot your shot, King.
I mean, I’ve sent a few messages, but it feels awkward, you know?
Bruh, cringe is dead. Just hit ‘em with “Hey, I’m super hyped about [company]. Any tips for standing out? 🫡”
Lol okay, I’ll try. Also, what’s your take on networking events? Worth it or nah?
Big W if you’re tryna collect those LinkedIn Pokédex connections, ngl. Be chill, no tryhard vibes. People love that.
Makes sense. Btw, congrats again on Synopsys! That’s huge. What made your application stand out?
Appreciate it fam 🙏. Honestly? Portfolio over everything. I showed off my side projects like a nerd flex, and they ate it up.
Side projects, huh? I’ve got some, but idk if they’re Synopsys-tier, you know?
Cap. Every project is a vibe if you sell it right. Talk about your struggles, lessons, and how you made it GOATed in the end.
Alright, I’ll revamp my GitHub. You think it’s worth blogging about my projects too?
BIG yes. Medium, LinkedIn, even a random Twitter thread. People love to see the process. Just be like, “Here’s how I turned chaos into code 🔥.”
Haha, okay, okay. And for the interviews, any tips to get over the nerves?
Lemme keep it 100: prep is your BFF. Leetcode, STAR method answers, and hydrate like you’re running a marathon. Fake confidence till it’s real, bro.
Thanks, man. I feel like I needed this pep talk. You’ve been killing it, and I appreciate the advice.
Anytime, my dude. You’re next up, trust. Just gotta stay in the grind and let the glow-up happen naturally. 🌟
You really think the glow-up’s coming? Feels like I’ve been grinding forever, and nothing’s clicking.
Bro, Rome wasn’t built in a day, and neither was your LinkedIn clout. Trust the process. Keep building.
I hear you. But, man, these rejection emails hit different. Like, how many times can I read “we’ve decided to move forward with other candidates”?
💀 that’s corporate ghosting with extra steps. But yo, every “no” gets you closer to the “yes.” It’s just math.
Math, huh? If only I could Leetcode my way out of this job hunt faster.
Lmaoo, imagine. “Find x where x = my dream job.” But fr, stick with your DSA grind, and don’t skip behavioral prep.
Speaking of, what’s a solid way to answer “tell me about yourself” without sounding basic?
EZ clap. Start with your story. “I’m a McMaster software engineer nerd with a passion for breaking things (in code).” Sprinkle your projects, and boom, magic.
Haha, breaking things in code… sounds about right. What about weaknesses? I never know how to spin that.
Oh, the classic “weakness but not really a weakness.” Say smth like, “I overanalyze, but it helps me write bug-free code.” GG.
Lol, nice. And for projects, what if they’re not super flashy? Like, does every recruiter want the next ChatGPT or something?
Nah bro, not everyone’s coding Skynet. Just show you can solve real problems. Even a clean to-do app can slap if the story’s good.
Okay, makes sense. Speaking of stories, what’s the wildest thing you pitched in an interview?
Bruhh, I once said my bug tracker was inspired by my messy dorm room 💀. They vibed with it tho. Just keep it real.
Haha, I can’t with you. Alright, I’ll keep my pitches authentic. Any advice on handling technical interview curveballs?
Big brain energy here: stay calm, explain your thought process, and if you’re stuck, ask questions. It’s about vibes, not just answers.
Right, vibes. Man, this whole process is like a giant DSA problem, isn’t it?
Facts. Job hunting = recursion. Keep trying till base case = job secured 💯.
Lol, base case: Qusay employed. Anyway, thanks for the advice, man. I feel a bit less lost now.
Always, my guy. We’re all just NPCs trying to level up. You’re gonna pop off soon, I can feel it. 🫡
